Conway's Game of Life is not just a game, but a zero-player simulation that demonstrates how complex patterns can emerge from simple rules. Watch as cells live, die, and evolve based on their neighbors, creating intricate designs and behaviors that mimic real-world phenomena.

üîç How It Works:
The Game of Life follows simple rules:
1. Any live cell with two or three live neighbors survives.
2. Any dead cell with three live neighbors becomes a live cell.
3. All other live cells die in the next generation. Similarly, all other dead cells stay dead.

Watch as these simple rules give rise to complex behaviors like still lifes, oscillators, and gliders!
